meanings.definition: A person who drinks heartily or with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The quaffer at the party finished his drink in one gulp.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the office quaffer because she always finishes her coffee quickly.
meanings.sent3: The quaffer at the bar was so enthusiastic that he accidentally spilled his drink.
meanings.sent4: He was a quaffer of knowledge, always eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent5: The quaffer's laughter echoed through the room as he enjoyed his drink.

meanings.definition: To drink something heartily or with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: He quaffed the refreshing lemonade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: She quaffed the delicious smoothie in just a few sips.
meanings.sent3: The kids quaffed their milkshakes before heading to the park.
meanings.sent4: The team quaffed victory drinks after winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The travelers quaffed from the crystal-clear stream to quench their thirst.
